name: A Moment of Silence
notes: 1 ounce apricot liqueur, preferably Marie Brizard Apry
1/4 ounce apple brandy, preferably Laird's Bonded

name: Army & Navy
origin: Documented by Embury (1948); linked to Army & Navy Club, Washington DC

name: Artichoke Hold

name: Batanga

name: Billionaire

name: Boulevardier
origin: Harry McElhone, Harry’s New York Bar (Paris, 1920s)

name: Broken Plane

name: Bronx
origin: Johnnie Solon, Waldorf-Astoria (New York City, c.1906)

name: Cinnamon Girl
origin: Brad Farran, Death & Co (New York City)

name: Cobble Hill
method: stir with a slice of cucumber

name: Colonel Carpano
notes: 3⁄4 oz Sweet vermouth, Carpano Antica Formula
origin: Italian vermouth-forward cocktail; contemporary origin unclear

name: Eastside
origin: Modern gin cucumber-mint sour; Pegu Club (NYC, 2000s)

name: Fassionola
origin: Tiki syrup with disputed origins; popularized by Don the Beachcomber (1930s)

name: Flor de Jerez
notes: Video variant sometimes shows lime; spec uses lemon.

name: French 75
origin: Harry’s New York Bar (Paris, WWI era; contested)

name: Get Lucky
origin: Scott Teague, Death & Co (New York City, c.2013)

name: Greenwood
origin: Tribute to Greenwood District, Tulsa, OK

name: Grenadine
origin: Pomegranate syrup used in cocktails since late 19th century; French origin

name: Grog
origin: British Royal Navy (Admiral Edward Vernon, mid-18th c.)

name: Growing Old

name: In Cold Blood

name: Julius Orange
origin: Milk & Honey (NYC, Petraske-era); likely modern citrus cocktail

name: Los Galgos Panky
origin: Los Galgos Cafe Notable (Buenos Aires, Argentina)

name: Macondo
origin: Colombian-inspired cocktail; name references Gabriel García Márquez's fictional town

name: Mad Max
origin: Modern craft cocktail; attribution unclear (popular in contemporary bar menus)

name: Man O' War
origin: Named for the racehorse (1920s; attribution unclear)

name: Man-about-Town
origin: Bitter whiskey cocktail from Jim Meehan, PDT (NYC)

name: Old Pal
origin: Harry McElhone, Harry’s New York Bar (Paris, 1920s)

name: Orgeat
origin: Almond syrup with Mediterranean origins, integral to tiki drinks

name: Pan American
spec_oz: Ronrico Gold Label Rum - Bacardi 8 (30 ml)
notes: ½ oz of pineapple juice (15 ml)
½ oz Ronrico Red Label Rum -
Dr Bird Pineapple (15 ml) ½ oz Ronrico White Label Rum -
origin: Charles H. Baker Jr., The Gentleman's Companion (1939)

name: Park Slope
origin: Brooklyn neighborhood–named cocktail by Giuseppe Gonzalez (NYC, c.2010s)

name: QPH Super Cocktail
origin: Queen's Park Hotel (Port of Spain, Trinidad), documented by Owen Rutter (1932)

name: Queens
origin: Early 20th-century borough cocktail, documented in 1930 Savoy Cocktail Book

name: Ramos Gin Fizz
method: dry shake, wet shake, top with soda

name: Ruby Red Paloma
notes: Thai basil sprig and grapefruit wedge for garnish

origin: Sazerac Coffee House / Antoine A. Peychaud (New Orleans, 19th c.)

name: Sidecar

name: Singapore Sling
origin: Ngiam Tong Boon, Raffles Hotel (Singapore, c.1915)

name: SouthSide
origin: Southside Sportsman's Club (Long Island, pre-Prohibition) or Chicago Prohibition-era origin

name: The Ramos Gin Fizz

name: The Stark

name: Tiger Tail
